item.title: The Fox Hunt Multiplayer Mode in Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater Arrives in October
item.content:encoded:
During Konami's Metal Gear Production Hotline presentation at Tokyo Game Show 2025, we finally got a release date for the Fox Hunt multiplayer mode coming to Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, which is due to arrive on October 30, 2025.

The multiplayer mode was first debuted back in June 2025, ahead of Metal Gear Solid Delta's launch this past August. Before its announcement, it wasn't clear if there would be a multiplayer mode in the remake like what was previously included in Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater. When it was revealed, it became clear that the answer to that question was still no; there wasn't going to be a multiplayer mode like what players had in MGS3.

Fox Hunt is markedly different than the old multiplayer mode, a change that, per what Konami said when it was first revealed, came out of a desire to "broadens the franchise’s core stealth element where players must utilize their environments to camouflage and evade opposing players."

Granted, it doesn't look like it's a bad change. The mode seems like it'll take good advantage of the stealth mechanics available in Metal Gear Solid Delta. What's perhaps most unfortunate about the coming mode, is that just ahead of MGSD: Snake Eater's launch, Konami confirmed it would not include support for crossplay.

We'll see if that changes in the future, potentially if players continue to ask for it to be added. In the meantime, at least we have a date to look forward to for when we can all try out Fox Hunt.

In other Metal Gear Solid news, Konami put out a survey for Tokyo Game Show 2025 asking players which MGS game they thing should get the remake treatment that MGS3 got with Delta.

item.title: All School Lockers Combinations in Silent Hill f – Guide
item.content:encoded:
After finding the Ebisugaoka Middle School 2F Stair Key and opening the Secret Box in Silent Hill f, there is another puzzle for you to solve before you can leave the haunting building behind, involving opening one of the lockers on the first floor. Here's every combination to unlock every locker in the area.

NOTE: This guide is based on Hard puzzle difficulty.

Silent Hill f School Lockers Puzzle Guide

  • All School Lockers Combinations
  • How Does This Puzzle Work
  • Asakura Ayumi Locker Combination (Mandatory)
  • Aoi Takeshi Locker Combination (Optional)
  • Suga Yosie Locker Combination (Optional)
  • TT Locker Combination (Optional)

All School Lockers Combinations

How Does This Puzzle Work

Finding every locker combination in Silent Hill f requires you to find multiple Origami of Grievances, where girls attending the school have written down the combinations. These clues, however, are written in a special code that can be understood by reading the explanation found in the northeastern corridor of the school's second floor. The key to the Locker Room on the first floor is found in the easternmost room of the same corridor.

Asakura Ayumi Locker Combination (Mandatory)

The combination to open this locker is 865, the number code for Bus. This is the only locker you must open to proceed in the main story, as it contains the Cabinet Key to open the cabinet in the school's office on the first floor.

Aoi Takeshi Locker Combination (Optional)

The combination to open this locker is 401, the number code for his name. It's the only locker located in the male locker room. Inside, you will find another Origami of Grievances to help you solve the puzzle.

Suga Yosie Locker Combination (Optional)

The combination to open this locker is 505, the code for SOS. Inside, you will find an item that will increase your inventory space.

TT Locker Combination (Optional)

The combination to open this locker is 377. Inside, you will find the Wolf Omamori, which increases damage dealt by weapons with high durability when equipped.

Still trying to reach the school and stuck solving some other puzzle? Check out our other Silent Hill f guides.
